subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Sergio García beat Oliver Wilson in a playoff in the rain-delayed HSBC Champions in Shanghai to give him a career-high No. 2 world ranking. In the first event of the 2009 European tour season, García forced the playoff by holing a 5-foot birdie on the par-5 18th to match Wilson at 14-under 274. Wilson, a surprise star for Europe in the Ryder Cup, reached the playoff by saving his par on No. 18 with a 7-footer for a 70. García made a 7-foot birdie on the second playoff hole — the 18th — after Wilson missed a 10-footer. ¶Pete Dye, who designed more than 200 golf courses laid out over four continents, was part of a six-member class inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame. He was joined by New Zealand’s Bob Charles, the first left-hander to win a major; Denny Shute, who won three majors in the 1930s; Carol Semple Thompson, a top amateur; Craig Wood, a two-time major winner; and Herbert Warren Wind, who spent 43 years writing about golf for The New Yorker and Sports Illustrated. (BLOOMBERG NEWS).
